author: gstein
msg: Get rid of the 'errors' thing and just throw exceptions. No real need
to try and report all errors at once; simplify the logic and report
one at a time for fixing.
Also shifted a bunch of data collection from the makefile generator to
the generic base class.
* build/gen_base.py:
(GeneratorBase.__init__): stop catching exceptions from the Target
creation. raise an error for unknown build types. shift code from
the makefile generator to collect source files, build directories,
script files, and more (oh my!)
(_Target.find_sources): stop returning 'errors' and rely on
exceptions instead.
(_collect_paths): raise exceptions rather than return an error flag
* build/gen_make.py:
(MakefileGenerator.write): stop collecting an 'errors' flag and just
raise (or allow) exceptions. shift a bunch of collection out to
the base class.

author: gstein
msg: Start some work to support SWIG extensions in our build system. With
the larger interest in the bindings, we need more help in building and
installing them.
* build.conf: bring [options] back and shift the path to the includes
there. add a new option for which languages have SWIG support.
add a bunch of sections for swig targets [format not yet set].
* build/gen_base.py:
(GeneratorBase.__init__): look up a target class based on the build
type, and instantiate it for the target object.
(_Target.__init__): remove type checks for defaulting the install
type. use a class attribute instead (via self.FOO).
(_Target.find_sources): use a class attribute rather than a global
type->pattern mapping.
(_TargetExe, _TargetScript, _TargetLib, _TargetDoc, _TargetSWIG):
new target classes.
(_build_types): new dict to map types to classes
(_default_sources): tossed in favor of class attrs
(_predef_sections): remove the [includes] section
* build/gen_make.py:
(MakefileGenerator.write): for swig types, just skip out for now.
look for include paths in the [options] section.
This is an empty revision for padding.

author: trow
msg: Greg Stein has (very wisely) suggested that the bindings for svn_opt.h
should be inside of the _util extension.  This gets rid of the
_opt namespace that I created in revision 3395 and lets SWIG do more
of the work.
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_opt.i
Deleted.
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_client.i
Remove the %import of svn_opt.i
* subversion/bindings/swig/python/setup.py
Removed the code to build the opt stuff.
* subversion/bindings/swig/swigutils_py.h
* subversion/bindings/swig/swigutils_py.c
Removed my misbegotten python -> svn_opt_revision_t marshaller.
* subversion/bindings/swig/util.i
Included svn_opt.h.

author: ballbach
msg: * Makefile: bug reading repository version from svn st update
